nodes.bodyText: In followup, if you can come up with a simple way to have one common setup for accounts-02, accounts-03, accounts-04, balances-02, balances-03, balances-05, and for new tests - that'd be great. If not, it's okay.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,69 @@
+{
+  "description": "Balance api calls for a range of balances",
+  "setup": {
+    "accounts": [
+      {
+        "entity_num": 17
+      },
+      {
+        "entity_num": 18
+      },
+      {
+        "entity_num": 19
+      },

+      },

+        "entity_num": 21
+      }
+    ],
+    "balances": [
+      {
+        "timestamp": 2345,
+        "id": 17,
+        "balance": 700
+      },
+      {
+        "timestamp": 2345,
+        "id": 18,
+        "balance": 200
+      },
+      {
+        "timestamp": 2345,
+        "id": 19,
+        "balance": 900
+      },
+      {
+        "timestamp": 2345,
+        "id": 20,
+        "balance": 450
+      },
+      {
+        "timestamp": 2345,
+        "id": 21,
+        "balance": 300
+      }
+    ],
+    "transactions": [],
+    "cryptotransfers": []
+  },
+  "url": "/api/v1/balances?account.balance=gt:300&account.balance=lte:700&&order=asc",

nodes.bodyText: So it just happens to be that they are the same, it's not by design, more so me just not changing stuff. In fact it's probably better that they are all different so there's no chance of any sticky logic or a false positives.
